posts.post_content:
Most of the combos people are suggesting for this don't work.  
  
1. "Until end of turn" effects still expire as usual.  
  
2. "Until next end step" effects are only delayed until your opponent's end step. Yes, it's a one-time trigger, but it's guaranteed to go off eventually -- if you skip one end step, it'll wait until the next, and go off then. If you use this with eg. [Sudden Disappearance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sudden Disappearance), your opponent gets everything back at the end step of their turn (or the endstep of whoever goes after you, if you're playing with more than two players; or, in any case, the next endstep that actually happens.) Skipping one endstep only delays it by one turn. Likewise, an [Ball Lightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ball Lightning) won't die the turn you activate it, but it'll die as soon as the next end step happens, whenever that is (usually the end of the next turn.)  
  
The oracle text only says that the end step doesn't happen the turn you activate it; but "next end step" effects will trigger, as ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
